emails.subject: RE: Password reset`
emails.body_text:
Hello Nic,

 

I hope you’re doing well.

 

I am writing to let you know that we have resolved the issue regarding the API file formats. Your integration should now pull the datasets as CSV files again, as originally expected.

 

The compression (zipping) logic has been corrected to ensure it no longer interferes with your API calls.

 

Thank you for your patience while we addressed this. Please let me know if you encounter any further issues with your data pulls.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/> 

 

 

From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 
Sent: Monday, January 5, 2026 13:27
To: nic <nic@polarstarfunds.com>
Cc: Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: Password reset`

 

Hello Nic,

 

Compliments of the season! I hope you’re doing well.

 

You are correct,we recently introduced file compression (zipping) to optimize large downloads. While this was primarily intended for UI-triggered downloads, we are currently investigating why this is affecting your API integration.

 

We will keep you posted on our progress and any necessary adjustments to your setup

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/>

Sent: Monday, January 5, 2026 9:06
To: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> >
Cc: Support Dnext <support@dnext.io <mailto:support@dnext.io> >
Subject: RE: Password reset`

 

Hi Saber

 

Compliments of the season, I hope you’re well.

 

I’d like to ask whether there have been any changes to the API through which we pull the SND datasets? It seems the file compression has been changed/added, as opposed to csv as before if I remember correctly? 

 

Is this a once-off or will the datasets now be zipped? 

 

Regards

Nic

I hope this email finds you well.

 

Password has been reset for @Casper Groenewald <mailto:casper@polarstarfunds.com>  and the new login credentials were sent privately to his inbox.

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>

emails.body_html:
Hello Nic,

 

I hope you’re doing well.

 

I am writing to let you know that we have resolved the issue regarding the API file formats. Your integration should now pull the datasets as CSV files again, as originally expected.

 

The compression (zipping) logic has been corrected to ensure it no longer interferes with your API calls.

 

Thank you for your patience while we addressed this. Please let me know if you encounter any further issues with your data pulls.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

You are correct,we recently introduced file compression (zipping) to optimize large downloads. While this was primarily intended for UI-triggered downloads, we are currently investigating why this is affecting your API integration.

 

We will keep you posted on our progress and any necessary adjustments to your setup

Thank you for your patience and understanding.
